name: Arion
description: Arion integrates Nix and Docker Compose to improve container development. It sorely needs a Main.hs. Your first Haskell command line tool?

name: arithmoi
description: arithmoi is a Haskell library for number theory: modular arithmetic, primes, elliptic curves, etc. It is also an excellent tool for Project Euler.

name: Asterius
description: A Haskell to WebAssembly compiler.

name: Cabal
description: Cabal is a system for building and packaging Haskell libraries and programs.

name: Clash
description: A-side: Tutorial; learn Clash and circuit design by building a stack-based (think Forth) CPU in Haskell. B-side: Nix/Haskell/Shake project setup for easy Clash-to-FPGA deployment.

name: Darcs
description: The darcs version control system.

name: DataHaskell core
description: Figuring out a native library and API for data science in Haskell.

name: Dhall Kubernetes
description: Dhall k8s is a library for working with k8s in dhall. It currently generates dhall code from swagger spec using python. However I wanna port it to Haskell so I can use the Dhall AST directly instead of strings.

name: Dronekit
description: Haskell API to communicate with vehicles over MAVLink.

name: Electronic Health Records Management as a Service
description: Enabling the bottom of pyramid through EHR and Radiology services on the cloud using open source spreadsheet powered by Glasgow Haskell Compiler on AWS and Google Cloud, Open Source Picture Archiving and Communications System and PyDICOM, Ethereum Blockchain Network. EHR as a service aims at providing secure data storage, transparent data movement and data authenticity along with early detection and prevention of diseases.

name: Elescore
description: Elevator and escalator disruption analysis.

name: Ex-Hack
description: Example-based Haskell Documentation

name: RON, Swarm, ff
description: RON is a protocol CRDT-based protocol of data exchange and presentation format. Swarm is an embeddable distributed fully-CRDT database. ff is a distributed personal and team task tracker and note taker (CLI, GUI). There are pure Haskell components as well as FFI to C++.

name: GG - git (G)UI
description: A tool for interactively manipulating the history of git repos and for making easy (enforcing) the usage of good (opinionated) practices.

name: GHC heap profiling - visualisation and improvements
description: Work on a new visualiser for heap profiles and/or other improvements to GHC's profiler.

name: Ginger
description: A pure Haskell implementation of the Jinja2 HTML template language.

name: Gonimo
description: Web based baby monitor

name: Haskell Katas
description: Learning methodology for Haskell

name: Haskell IDE Core
description: A lightweight, extensible base for LSP IDE tooling based on Shake and GHC Lib

name: hatrace
description: System call tracing library in Haskell. We need your help to add more syscalls and can mentor you through the process. You can learn Haskell FFI, C, Assembly, Linux and practical Haskell programming.

name: hnix
description: An implementation of the Nix language in Haskell

name: IHaskell
description: A Haskell kernel for the Jupyter project

name: Juvix
description: Haskell/Idris to Michelson/WASM smart contract compiler (work in progress).

name: Linear types in GHC
description: Adding linear types to GHC.

name: massiv
description: Efficient Haskell Arrays featuring Parallel computation.

name: Modeling functional languages with MLIR
description: MLIR proposes a JSON for compiler IRs. Let's explore how a dialect for a functional language could look like. I am personally interested in lean, but would like to understand well which properties translate well across languages.

name: niv
description: Easy dependency management for Nix projects.

name: Shake
description: Shake build system.

name: nix-tools
description: A better haskell infrastructure for nix

name: conferer
description: I'd like to build a haskell config library along the lines of Java's spring-config.

name: optics
description: Rich hierarchy of optic kinds (as in the lens library) encapsulated in an abstract interface

name: Ormolu
description: A new formatter for Haskell source code.

name: pandoc
description: Universal document converter

name: Pomelo
description: Pomelo is a new FRP library, whose development is just starting. Key goals for Pomelo are a clean semantics and an efficient implementation.

name: porcupine
description: EDSL to express data pipelines in a datasource and serialization agnostic manner. Each task of the pipeline automatically exposes the parameters it accepts and the data sources it needs (so they can't be rebound without recompiling) to the outside world.

name: Plutus
description: The Plutus platform is a smart contract platform consisting of a small functional programming language, a compiler from Haskell to Plutus, and library support for writing contracts.

name: PureScript ES Modules
description: Add ES modules code generation to PureScript compiler. One benefit is better dead code elimination (tree shaking) for PureScript with popular JavaScript bundlers such as webpack, Parcel, etc.

name: Rome
description: Remote cache for binary artifacts.

name: servant
description: A library for writing web applications, deriving clients and more.

name: Smos
description: A purely functional semantic forest editor to replace Emacs' Org Mode.

name: snack
description: Nix-based incremental build tool for Haskell projects.

name: spago
description: PureScript package manager and build tool powered by Dhall and Spacchetti.

name: static-haskell-nix
contact: Niklas Hambüchen, Bas van Dijk, Roel van Dijk
description: Easily build most Haskell programs into fully static Linux executables.

name: streaming-lmdb
description: Stream data to or from an LMDB database. What I wrote seems to work, but I would love to get feedback or help write something from scratch if you have better ideas.

name: TaskLite
description: CLI task / todo manager built with Haskell and SQLite

name: The GRIN Compiler
description: GRIN is a compiler back-end for lazy and strict functional languages with whole program optimization support.

name: traze
description: traze is a MQTT based tronlike multiplayer game with a Gameserver implementation in Haskell.

name: Morley
description: Hacking on developer tools for the smart contract language of Tezos with Serokell and TQ

name: versioning
description: Type-safe data versioning.

name: harch
description: Command line tool for archiving files and directories (to S3). Built using turtle

name: Archetype
description: Archetype is another attempt at IDL (interface description/definition language) inspired by Dhall configuration language.
